properties.entry: Controls access to create, edit, and delete dynamic billing files.
Show a Versacom Serial Number SortBy display.
Show an Expresscom Serial Number SortBy display.
Show a DCU SA205 Serial Number SortBy display.
Show a DCU SA305 Serial Number SortBy display.
The commands group name for the displayed commands.
Allow the ability to read values from a device.
Allow the ability to write values to a device.
Allow the ability to control a disconnect to a device.
Allow the ability to read values from an LM device.
Allow the ability to write values to an LM device.
Allow the ability to control an LM device.
Allow the ability to read values from a Cap Control device.
Allow the ability to write values to a Cap Control device.
Allow the ability to control a Cap Control device.
Allow the ability to execute commands which do not fall under another role property.
Allow the ability to execute manual commands.
Controls access to web commander applications.
Controls access to client commander application.
Controls whether the Loadmanagement menu item in the View menu is displayed.
Controls whether the System menu item in the View menu is displayed.
Allows the editor panel for the mutual exclusion of transmissions to be shown.
Closes off all access to logins and login groups for non-administrators in the dbeditor.
This feature is for development purposes only.
Allows member management of LM Direct Programs through the DBEditor.
The number of minutes a login is disabled when an account is locked out.
The number of login attempts before an account is locked out.
The number of days before a login is expired and needs to be changed.
The number of hours a user has to wait before changing their password again.
The minimum number of characters a password has to be before it passes.
The number of different passwords retained before a user can reuse a password.
The number of policy rules that are required to be able to save a password.
Uppercase characters count toward the required policy quality check. (A, B, C, ... Z)
Lowercase characters count toward the required policy quality check. (a, b, c, ... z)
Base 10 digits count toward the required policy quality check. (0, 1, 2, ... 9)
Nonalphanumic characters count toward the required password rules check. (~, !, @, #, $, %, ^, &, *, _, -, +, =, `, |, (, ), {, }, [, ], :, ", ', <, >, ,, ., ?, /)
Access to Load Management group reports.
Access to Cap Control group reports.
Access to C&I Curtailment group reports.
The following settings are valid: CREATE_SCHEDULE(0x0000000C), ENABLE_SCHEDULE(0x000000C0), ABLE_TO_START_SCHEDULE(0x00000C00)
The number of rows shown before creating a new page of data.
The following settings are valid: HIDE_MACS(0x00001000), HIDE_CAPCONTROL(0x00002000), HIDE_LOADCONTROL(0x00004000), HIDE_ALL_DISPLAYS(0x0000F000), HIDE_ALARM_COLORS(0x80000000)
Total number alarms that are displayed in the quick access list.
How many decimal places to show for real values.
Tells TDC to show the LoadControl reduction column or not.
The disclaimer that appears with trends.
Controls access to retrieve meter data on demand.
Minimum duration (in minutes) between get data now events.
Maximum number of get data now scans available daily.
The url to take the user immediately after logging into the Yukon web application.
The web client cascading style sheet.
The url where the user login from. It is used as the url to send the users to when they log off.
Java Web Start to access client applications is no longer supported.
Disable stack traces for this user.
The number of milliseconds between requests for the latest point values on pages that support the data updater.
A comma separated list of URLs for CSS files that will be included on every Standard Page.
The name of the theme to be applied to this group.
Ability to receive point alarms as alerts.
Default TimeZone (e.g. America/Denver, America/Chicago, America/Los_Angeles, or America/New_York)
The amount of idle time (in minutes) before a user's session will expire.
The text to display for fixed/static capbanks
Sets accessibility to the CapControl module.
How many decimal places to show for real values for PowerFactor.
Allows users to toggle OV/UV usage for capbanks, substations, subs, and feeders.
Allows the user to view/modify the database set up for all CapControl items.
Show flip command for Cap Banks with 7010 type controller.
Show Cap Bank Addititional Info tab
Capbank sized in these states will be added to the available sum.
Capbank sized in these states will be added to the unavailable sum.
Capbank sized in these states will be added to the tripped sum.
Capbank sized in these states will be added to the closed sum.
Allows the user to Add comments to Cap Bank objects.
Allows the user to Modify comments on Cap Bank objects.
If the user does not provide a comment, a default comment will be stored.
Allows access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for CapControl Areas.
Allows access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for CapControl Substations.
Allows access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for CapControl SubBuses.
Allows access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for CapControl Feeders.
Allows access to Field Operation Commands, Non-Operational Commands and Yukon Actions for CapControl CapBanks/CBCs.
Controls whether to display confirmation pop-ups for all Cap Control commands, only Operational commands or for no commands.
Allows access to the Cap Control importers
Controls whether to show the general account information.
Controls whether to show the program control history.
Controls whether to enable the program enrollment feature.
Controls whether to enable the program opt out/reenable feature.
Controls whether to enable the thermostat programming feature.
Controls whether to show the contact information of the energy company.
Controls whether to show customer FAQs
Controls access for customers to change their own login username.
Controls whether to allow programming multiple thermostats at one time.
Controls access for customers to change their own login password.
Controls whether to enable grouped control history display.
The duration, in days, for the customer Opt Out period. (Use commas to separate multiple values: Ex. 1,3,4,5)
Contains information on Opt Out limits.
Turns residential side contact access on or off.
Prevents residential side opt outs from being available for scheduling beyond the current day.
Allows end-users to see a sign-out link when accessing their account pages.
Controls access to select individual devices or forces all device selection when opting out. When true, individual device selection is unavailable and all devices are forced to opt out.
Enables you to enroll in multiple programs within an appliance category.
Displays a second web page that allows for enrollment by individual device per program.
Enables auto mode functionality for the account.enrollment by individual device per program.
Allow load management program constraints to be CHECKED before starting.
Allow load management program constraints to be OBSERVED before starting.
Allow load management program constraints to be OVERRIDDEN before starting.
The default program constraint selection prior to starting a program.
Activates the ability to change gears as part of manually stopping a load program.
Allow access to all load management objects. Set to true to force the use of per pao permissions.
Controls access to view Control Areas.
Controls whether the start now checkbox is checked by default in demand response.
Specifies the default duration for a control event in minutes for demand response.
Controls whether the schedule stop check box is checked by default in demand response.
Specifies the default start time for a control event in the format (hh:mm). It will use the current time if no time has been supplied.
Allow control of demand response control areas, scenarios, programs and groups.
Controls access to view Asset Availability for Scenarios, Control Areas, Programs, and Load Groups.
Controls access to actions and information related to ecobee devices.
Controls access to change gears for scenarios, control areas, and load programs. Requires Allow DR Control.
Controls access to enable or disable control areas, load programs and load groups. Requires Allow DR Control.
In addition to Allow DR Control, controls access to shed and restore at group level.
Controls access to view Control Area Trigger related information.
Controls access to view Control Area, Program, and Group Priority.
Controls access to view Program and Group Reduction.
The number of outgoing channels assigned to the specified voice application.
The URL used to initiate a call; see documentation for allowed variables.
A Java Regular Expression that will be matched against the output of the URL to determine if the call was successful.
Either a URL base where the notification templates will be stored (file: or http:) or a directory relative to YUKON_BASE.
Allows full control of all energy companies and other administrator features.
Controls access to edit the user's energy company settings.
Controls whether to allow managing the energy company's members.
Controls whether to allow monitoring of all batched switch commands.
Controls whether to allow monitoring of all scheduled opt out events.
Ignored if not a member company -- Controls whether operator logins are shown on the EC administration page.
Ignored if not a member company -- Controls whether routes are visible through the EC administration page.
Allows for multiple user-created warehouses instead of a single generic warehouse.
Controls access to configure the MultiSpeak Interfaces.
Controls visibility of LM objects for 3-tier and direct control, based off assignment of users.
Controls the ability to edit and create device configurations.
Controls the ability to view existing device configurations.
Controls access to manually build Lucene indexes.
Controls access to view or download log files.
Controls access to database migration tool.
Controls access to event logs feature.
Controls access to manage all user defined dashboards.
Controls access to the C&I Curtailment operator functionality. When false, only the C&I Curtailment user pages are available.
Controls whether to show the customer residence information.
Controls whether to enable the call tracking feature.
Controls whether to show the metering interval data.
Controls whether to show the program control history.
Controls whether to enable the program enrollment feature.
Controls whether to enable the program opt out/reenable feature.
Controls whether to show the appliance information.
Controls whether to enable the appliance creation feature.
Controls whether to show the hardware information.
Controls whether to enable the hardware creation feature.
Controls whether to enable the thermostat programming feature.
Controls whether to enable the service request feature.
Controls access to web services that retrieve LM data.
Controls access to web services that perform LM control.
Controls access to change a customer login username.
Controls access to change a customer login password.
Controls whether to show customer FAQs.
Controls whether to allow programming multiple thermostats at one time.
Controls whether to allow new trends to assigned to the customer.
Controls whether to enable the new account wizard.
Controls whether to enable the customer account importing feature.
The duration, in days, for the customer Opt Out period. (Use commas to separate multiple values: Ex. 1,3,4,5)
Disables the ability to send configs and connects/disconnects to switches.
Can be used to disable the ability to edit and delete customer account information.
Prevents operator side opt outs from being available for scheduling beyond the current day.
Determines whether an operator can see current opt out status on the Opt Out Admin page.
Determines whether an operator can enable or disable Opt Outs for the rest of the day.
Determines whether an operator can cancel (reenable) ALL currently Opted Out devices.
Determines whether an operator can change from Opt Outs count against limits today to Opt Outs do not count.
Enables you to use account searching.
Enables editing of opt out surveys.
Controls access to bulk import operations.
Controls access to bulk update operations.
Controls editing of Device Groups (Add/Remove Group, update name, etc.)
Controls modifying contents of a Device Group (Add to/Remove from group, etc.)
Controls access to group command actions.
Controls access to mass change collection actions. Includes all Mass Change actions.
Controls access to locate route action.
Controls access to mass delete devices action.
Controls access to Add, Update and Remove Points collection actions.
Controls access to Assign Config collection action.
Controls access to Send Config and Read Config collection actions.
Controls access to Archived Data Analysis collection action.
Controls access to FDR Translation Manager bulk operation.
Controls access to Archived Data Export.
Controls access to Connect/Disconnect collection action.
Controls access to Demand Reset collection action.
Controls access to RF data streaming configuration actions.
Controls whether to allow adding hardware by serial number range.
Controls whether to allow updating hardware by serial number range.
Controls whether to allow deleting hardware by serial number range.
Controls whether to allow creating new hardware.
Controls whether an opt out command should also contain a restore.
Activates the purchasing section of the inventory module.
Controls access to Inventory Configuration Tool.
Enables you to use inventory searching.
Allows access to the Bulk Importer.
Controls access to submit a (past) profile collection request.
Enables automatic archiving of move in/move out transactions.
Controls access to process a move in/move out.
Controls access to start/stop scanning of profile data.
Controls access to process a high bill complaint.
Controls access to Tamper Flag Processing.
Controls access to the Status Point Monitor.
Controls access to the Porter Response Monitor.
Controls access to Disconnect, Connect, and Arm operations.
Controls access to the Device Data Monitor.
Controls access to the Water Leak Report.
Controls access to the Usage Threshold Report.
The operator specific name for odds for control.
Controls the ability to view, start/stop, enable/disable, edit, create, delete for MACS Script.
Controls access to create, delete, or update scheduled reads. If false, access is view only.
Controls whether to allow showing all work orders.
Controls whether to allow creating new work orders.
Controls whether to allow reporting on work orders.
Customizable label for the additional order number field.
Controls the ability to create and edit infrastructure devices. i.e. RF Gateways.
Controls the ability to delete infrastructure devices. i.e. RF Gateways.
Controls the ability to send configuration commands to infrastructure devices. i.e. RF Gateways.
Controls the ability to view infrastructure devices. i.e. RF Gateways.
Controls the ability to create, edit, or delete endpoint devices. i.e Meters. Metering Role controls view access.
Controls the ability to edit, delete, or manually add point data values.
Controls the ability to view, create, edit, or delete points.
Controls the ability to view, create, edit, or delete notes.
